page.title: 10GRAVEL PITS
page.content: Some of the gravel pits are still worked. We saw gravel lorries, a digger with caterpillar tracks, elevators, a tractor and trailer, a caravan and a cement mixer at a pit near Woolpit. We saw a man drive away a lorry load of sand. We were allowed to go in, but we had to keep away from the edge of the pit. In Drinkstone there are disused gravel pits. We visited a two-acre pit owned by Mr. Clarke. Rubbish is being dumped here because the old pit is deep and dangerous and is no use. We saw all kinds of rubbish, bricks, plaster, mattresses, beds, cookers and garden refuse. When the tip is full, top soil will be spread all over it. Then the farmer hopes to re-seed the land, and possibly use it to graze sheep.
